title: my email headers are there, but no email content visible. Using Thunderbird Ver.115.7.0

creator: ljlinch

title: Unexpected drag and drop function
content:
Hello folks,

Have been trying to sort this problem for last couple of weeks with some limited success, first up I would say it may not be a Thunderbird issue but need to eliminate this along the way.

Problem relates to simple drag and drop functionality within Windows Explorer, selecting a file from right hand pane then left clicking before dragging to new folder location would cause unpredictable results, typically grabbing a whole tree of other folders and moving those too, the exact same problem applied to Thunderbird when moving emails either individually or as a group.

Desktop PC running Win 10 Pro, it does have a fancy graphics card with competing drivers, uninstalled everything and reinstalled with a clean install - this resolved the problem (so far) with Windows Explorer but puzzlingly has made no difference to Thunderbird, options tried so far include:

Using a different mouse Selecting 'click lock' from mouse controls - this works but it does feel a bit awkward Using another email client Outlook for desktop, doesn't seem as pronounced but still a bit awkward. Reverting back to Windows basic default graphics driver, all works as should but looks terrible

Has anyone come across this behaviour before?

Thanks
creator: JustOne

title: Move attachments pane back to the top right corner
content: Is there any way to make it so the attachments pane (when composing a message) is moved back to the top right corner of the email instead of being at the bottom? I'll attach a screenshot. I asked this question in 2021 after updating to Thunderbird 91.1.2 and the answer I got was to use an add-on called MoreLayouts, which had been working great the last few years but after the latest update (115.7.0) it says it's no longer supported. The only other solution I've been able to find is to use BetterBird but I'd much rather stick with TB if there's a way to do it. Thanks for your help
creator: manmachine78

title: cannot send emails - it says outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.telstra.com timed out
content: Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.telstra.com timed out. Try again.
creator: werwaks4
